# Self-Hosted GitHub Actions Runner Setup\n\n## Overview\n\nThis repository uses a

self-hosted

GitHub Actions runner to execute CI/CD workflows on local infrastructure. This
provides
better
control over resources, permissions, and access to local services.\n\n##
Benefits\n\n-
**Permissions**: Full control over repository and workflow permissions\n\n-
**Resources**:
Use your
own hardware specifications\n\n- **Local Access**: Test against local Ceph
clusters, VMs,
networks\n\n- **Cost**: No GitHub Actions minutes consumed\n\n-
**Customization**: Install
any
tools, dependencies, or services needed\n\n## Prerequisites\n\n- Windows 10/11
or Windows
Server
2019+\n\n- PowerShell 5.1 or later\n\n- Administrator access (for service
installation)\n\n- Network
access to GitHub

runners
can access your local network\n\n- Only use self-hosted runners for trusted
repositories\n\n-
Consider network isolation (VLAN, firewall rules)\n\n- Use dedicated user account with
minimal
permissions\n### Secrets Management\n- GitHub secrets are available to self-hosted
runners\n\n-
Ensure runner machine is secured\n\n- Use Windows Credential Manager for additional
secrets\n\n-
Rotate secrets regularly\n### Updates\n- Keep runner software updated\n\n- Update OS and
security
patches regularly\n\n- Monitor GitHub security advisories\n## Monitoring\n### Runner

Copy and use immediately\n\n## Security Considerations (2)\n\n### Runner Isolation
(2)\n\n-
Self-hosted runners can access your local network\n\n- Only use self-hosted runners for
trusted
repositories\n\n- Consider network isolation (VLAN, firewall rules)\n\n- Use dedicated
user account
with minimal permissions\n\n### Secrets Management (2)\n\n- GitHub secrets are available
to
self-hosted runners\n\n- Ensure runner machine is secured\n\n- Use Windows Credential
Manager for
additional secrets\n\n- Rotate secrets regularly\n\n### Updates (2)\n\n- Keep runner
software
updated\n\n- Update OS and security patches regularly\n\n- Monitor GitHub security
advisories\n\n##
Monitoring (2)\n\n### Runner Logs (2)\n\nLocated in`C:\actions-runner\*diag\`:\n\n-
`Runner**.log`:
Main runner logs\n\n- `Worker**.log`: Job execution logs\n\n### Performance Metrics
(2)\n\nMonitor:\n\n- CPU usage during workflow runs\n\n- Disk space in
`*work`directory\n\n- Network
bandwidth\n\n- Memory usage\n\n### Cleanup (2)\n\nAutomatically cleans up after each job,
but you
can manually clean:\n\n```powershell\n### Token Expired (2)\n\n- *Symptoms**:

Self-hosted
runners can access your local network\n\n- Only use self-hosted runners for trusted
repositories\n\n- Consider network isolation (VLAN, firewall rules)\n\n- Use dedicated
user account
with minimal permissions\n### Secrets Management (5)\n- GitHub secrets are available to
self-hosted
runners\n\n- Ensure runner machine is secured\n\n- Use Windows Credential Manager for
additional
secrets\n\n- Rotate secrets regularly\n### Updates (5)\n- Keep runner software
updated\n\n- Update
OS and security patches regularly\n\n- Monitor GitHub security advisories\n## Monitoring
(5)\n###

logs\n\n-
`Worker**.log`: Job execution logs\n### Performance Metrics (5)\nMonitor:\n\n- CPU usage
during
workflow runs\n\n- Disk space in `*work`directory\n\n- Network bandwidth\n\n- Memory
usage\n###

(8)\n\n-
Self-hosted runners can access your local network\n\n- Only use self-hosted runners for
trusted
repositories\n\n- Consider network isolation (VLAN, firewall rules)\n\n- Use dedicated
user account
with minimal permissions\n\n### Secrets Management (8)\n\n- GitHub secrets are available
to
self-hosted runners\n\n- Ensure runner machine is secured\n\n- Use Windows Credential
Manager for
additional secrets\n\n- Rotate secrets regularly\n\n### Updates (8)\n\n- Keep runner
software
updated\n\n- Update OS and security patches regularly\n\n- Monitor GitHub security
advisories\n\n##
Monitoring (8)\n\n### Runner Logs (8)\n\nLocated in`C:\actions-runner\*diag\`:\n\n-
`Runner**.log`:
Main runner logs\n\n- `Worker**.log`: Job execution logs\n\n### Performance Metrics
(8)\n\nMonitor:\n\n- CPU usage during workflow runs\n\n- Disk space in
`_work`directory\n\n- Network
bandwidth\n\n- Memory usage\n\n### Cleanup (8)\n\nAutomatically cleans up after each job,
but you
can manually clean:\n\n```powershell\n# Remove old logs\nRemove-Item

C:\actions-runner\_work\*-Recurse -Force\n```text\nRemove-Item

(Zombie
Job)\nIf the runner appears`online`and`busy`in GitHub settings, but no jobs are running
(or`gh run
list --status in_progress`returns 0), the runner process might be
desynchronized.\n\n-*Symptoms:**\n\n- GitHub Actions queue is stuck (jobs are "Queued" but
not
starting).\n\n- Runner logs (`_diag`folder) show it renewing a job ID that doesn't exist
in
GitHub.\n\n-*Resolution:**\nForce restart the runner service to kill the zombie
process.\n\n```powershell\n\n### Runner Stuck in "Busy" State (Zombie Job) (2)\n\nIf the
